item.title: Radiola 9.0.0
item.description:
• The program uses ffmpeg library to read and decode audio. So now the program supports all common codecs, in particular FLAC.
  • The program shows ICY metadata from HTTPS streams.
  • Added multiple selections to the radio station list.

item.title: Radiola 8.1.1
item.description:
• Fixed the program crashing on older versions of macOS.
  • Translations updated.

item.title: Radiola 8.1.0
item.description:
• Support for CMD+C and CMD+V in station window and station/group add dialogs.
  • German and Italian translations have been added.
  • Added an option to float the history window over of other windows.

item.title: Radiola 8.0.0
item.description:
• The listening history is saved between program launches.
  • The maximum width of the manin menu was limited. With long song titles, the menu was unreasonably wide.
  • Added a menu item to copy a station to the local list.
  • Added possibility to intrenationalize the program interface. See https://github.com/SokoloffA/radiola/wiki/How-to-translate if you want to help.
  • Improved work with menu bar managers.
  • Improved integration with now playing panel.
  • Minor improvements in the appearance and behavior of the program.

item.title: Radiola 7.0.2
item.description: • Bug fixed. Settings window was not showing on older versions of macOS.

item.title: Radiola 7.0.1
item.description: • The program did not save the station list when the application was first started.

item.title: Radiola 7.0.0
item.description:
• Added buttons for copying station title and URL.
  • You can start/stop playback by pressing the spacebar.
  • When a song you really like is playing, you can tag it and quickly find it in your history.
  • Some stations transmit metadata in JSON format, now the song title and artist are displayed correctly (at least for some stations).
  • Added global hotkeys to show main window, history and settings.
  • Added the ability to export programs to XML file and import from it.
  • Fix: Sometimes after an unsuccessful attempt to connect to one station, the program could not connect to any other station.
  • Minor improvements in the appearance and behavior of the program.

item.title: Radiola 6.1.0
item.description:
• Fix: The search bar was partially displayed at small window width.
  • Fix: Due to a bug it was not possible to change the output audio device.
  • In paused state the program does not consume network traffic.
  • Links to the home page and issue tracker have been added to the "About Radiola" dialog.

item.title: Radiola 6.0.1
item.description: • Remove the 2nd item of local stations, which is needed only for tests.

item.title: Radiola 6.0
item.description:
• You can search and listen to stations from radio-browser.info.
  • Improved work with multimedia keys.
  • The current station and track are displayed in the system Now Playing info center.
  • Buffering is enabled, now the sound is not interrupted in case of short internet interupts.

item.title: Radiola 5.2
item.description:
• Added ability to mute volume by clicking on the status bar icon.
  • The mute mode is indicated by a special icon in the status bar.
  • You can turn on the previous/next track multimedia key handling. Going to the previous/next station in the favorite stations list is now supported.
  • Added a timeout of 15 seconds to connect to a station.
  • Small improvements in the appearance and behaviour of the program.

item.title: Radiola 5.1.1
item.description: • Fixed the direction of volume change when the "Natural Scrolling" mode is enabled

item.title: Radiola 5.1
item.description:
• You can customize how the program handle multimedia keys:
    • Always handles play/pause key presses (previous behaviour).
    • Ignore multimedia keys.
    • Handle the play/pause key only if the main window is open.
  • A mute button has been added to the main program window.
  • Now you can change the volume by rolling mouse scroll wheel over the status bar icon. This is configurable in the settings.

item.title: Radiola 5.0
item.description:
• Added the ability to play the last station directly after startup. Thanks @Paulchen-Panther!
  • Now you can configure different actions for different mouse buttons. The following actions are available:
    • Show the popup menu
    • Toggle play/pause playback
    • Show the main program window
    • Show the history window

item.title: Radiola 4.0
item.description:
• You can create groups from a station like a tree.
  • In preferences you can choose the style of ground stations in the main menu. Grouped favorite stations can be displayed in three ways:
    • Like a flat list. All stations are displayed one below the other, without any indentation.
    • With margins. All stations are displayed without a submenu, but the names of stations from the group are visually shifted to the right by a couple of characters.
    • As a submenu. Each group is represented as a submenu.
  • Added volume control to the main menu. You can enable this in the preferences dialog.
  • In the preferences dialog, you can specify the audio device which the program will use. By default, the standard system device is used.

item.title: Radiola 3.0
item.description:
• Redesigned station window
    • Nice looking stations table
    • The current station and song are displayed in the window title bar
    • Added volume control
  • A history window has been added. Now you can see the names of songs you recently listened to
